intro: Trema rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed trema, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its stems are often reddish in color, giving it its common name. Trema rufescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
